Wisdom: مَنْ صَوَّرَ الْمَوْتَ بَيْنَ عَيْنَيْهِ هَانَ أَمْرُ الدُّنْيَا عَلَيْهِ
enWisdom: One who visualizes death before his very own eyes, the affairs of this world become easy [and trivial] for him

Wisdom: مَنْ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ ذِكْرِ الْمَوْتِ رَضِيَ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا بِالْكَفَافِ
enWisdom: One who frequently remembers death is pleased with whatever suffices him of this world

Wisdom: مَنْ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ ذِكْرِ الْمَوْتِ قَلَّتْ فِي الدُّنْيَا رَغْبَتُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever frequently remembers death, his desire in [the pleasures of] this world is reduced

Wisdom: كَيْفَ يَزْهَدُ فِي الدُّنْيَا مَنْ لَا يَعْرِفُ قَدْرَ الْآخِرَةِ
enWisdom: How can one who does not know the value of the Hereafter renounce worldly pleasures?!
